extension.description:
libretro port of bNES, a NES emulator.
Supported files: .nes
Authors: byuu, Ryphecha.
Source: https://github.com/libretro/bnes-libretro

Libretro implementation of the core emulation in bSNES, a Super Nintendo (SNES) emulator. Written by byuu, ported by Ver Greeneyes and Themaister.
Supported files: .sfc, .smc
Icon credit: Alucryd (alucryd.deviantart.com)
Source: http://gitorious.org/bsnes/bsnes

Libretro implementation of the core emulation in bSNES, a Super Nintendo (SNES) emulator. Written by byuu, ported by Ver Greeneyes and Themaister.
Supported files: .sfc, .smc
Icon credit: Alucryd (alucryd.deviantart.com)
Source: http://gitorious.org/bsnes/bsnes

Libretro implementation of the core emulation in bSNES, a Super Nintendo (SNES) emulator. Written by byuu, ported by Ver Greeneyes and Themaister.
Supported files: .sfc, .smc
Icon credit: Alucryd (alucryd.deviantart.com)
Source: http://gitorious.org/bsnes/bsnes

DOSBox emulates an IBM PC compatible computer running MS-DOS. DOSBox can be configured to run a wide range of DOS games, from CGA/Tandy/PCjr classics up to games from the Quake era.
Supported files: .exe, .com, .bat, .conf. If loading exe/com/bat the system directory will be searched for a 'dosbox.conf' file to load. If loading a *.conf file DOSBox will be loaded with the options in the config file.
Source: https://github.com/libretro/dosbox-libretro

Final Burn Alpha is an emulator of arcade games. Currently, FB Alpha supports games on Capcom CPS-1 and CPS-2 hardware, SNK Neo-Geo hardware, Toaplan hardware, Cave hardware, Sega System 16, and various games on miscellaneous hardware. FB Alpha is based on the original FinalBurn.
Supported files: .iso, .zip
Icon credit: TRIPLEKILLZ (triplekillz.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/libretro/fba-libretro
extension.disclaimer: The authors of FB Alpha don't guarantee its fitness for any purpose, implied or otherwise, and do not accept responsibility for any damages whatsoever that might occur when using FB Alpha. All games emulated by FB Alpha, including any images and sounds therein, are copyrighted by their respective copyright holders.

extension.description:
Port of FCEUmm / FCEUX to Libretro. FCEUX is a NES, Famicom, and Famicom Disk System (FDS) emulator. The concept behind FCEUX is to merge elements from FCEU Ultra, FCEU rerecording, FCEUXD, FCEUXDSP, FCEUXDSP CE, and FCEU-mm into a single branch of FCEU.
Supported files: .fds, .nes, .unif
Icon credit: Anarkhya (anarkhya.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/libretro/fceu-next

Gambatte is an accuracy-focused, open-source, cross-platform Game Boy Color emulator written in C++. It is based on hundreds of corner case hardware tests, as well as previous documentation and reverse engineering efforts.
Supported files: .gb, .gbc, .dmg
Source: https://github.com/libretro/gambatte-libretro
extension.disclaimer: Game Boy and Game Boy Color are registered trademarks of Nintendo of America, Inc. Gambatte is not affiliated with or endorsed by any of the companies mentioned.

extension.description:
An enhanced port of Genesis Plus to the libretro API. Support for SG-1000, Mark-III, Master System, Game Gear, Mega Drive & Mega CD hardware. Enhancements backported by twinaphex from the GX version (Gamecube/Wii port).
Supported files: .md, .smd, .bin, .cue, .gen, .iso, .sms, .gg, .sg, .zip
Source: https://github.com/libretro/Genesis-Plus-GX

Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. This is a port of the Mednafen GBA core to the libretro API.
Supported files: .gba
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. This is a port of the Mednafen NGP core to the libretro API.
Supported files: .ngp, .ngc
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

extension.summary: Mednafen v0.9.28 PC Engine / TurboGrafx 16 / SuperGrafx
extension.description:
Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. The "pce_fast" Mednafen emulation module is an experimental alternative to the pce emulation module, modified for speed at the expense of (usually) unneeded accuracy.
Supported files: .pce, .sgx, .cue
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. This is port of the Mednafen PSX core to the libretro API. PlayStation 1 emulation is currently in a buggy alpha state and not all hardware and features are emulated. A dual-core Phenom II or Athlon II at 3GHz or higher, or rough equivalent, is recommended for running Mednafen's PlayStation 1 emulation. PSF1 playback is supported.
Supported files: .cue, .toc, .m3u
Icon credit: Anarkhya (anarkhya.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. This is a port of the Mednafen VB core to the libretro API.
Supported files: .vb, .vboy, .bin
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

Mednafen is a portable multi-system emulator. This is a port of the Mednafen WonderSwan core to the libretro API. Mednafen's WonderSwan (Color) emulation is based off of Cygne.
Supported files: .ws, .wsc
Source: https://github.com/libretro/mednafen-libretro

Meteor is a Nintendo Gameboy Advance emulator.
Supported files: .gba
Authors: Philippe Daouadi <p.daouadi@free.fr>, Hans-Kristian Arntzen (libretro port and fixes) <maister@archlinux.us>
Source: https://github.com/libretro/meteor-libretro

Nestopia is a portable open source NES/Famicom emulator. It is designed to be as accurate as possible and supports a large number of peripherals. The hardware is emulated at cycle-by-cycle granularity, ensuring full support for software that does mid-scanline and other timing trickery.
Supported files: .nes, .fds
Icon credit: Anarkhya (anarkhya.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/libretro/nestopia

NXEngine is a complete open-source clone/rewrite of the masterpiece jump-and-run platformer Doukutsu Monogatari (also known as Cave Story).
Supported files: .exe
Source: https://github.com/libretro/nxengine-libretro

PrBoom is a version of the classic 3D shoot'em'up game Doom, originally written by id Software. To play PrBoom, you need one of the main Doom data files (called the IWAD) from id Software - doom.wad, doom2.wad, tnt.wad or plutonia.wad - or the shareware doom1.wad.
If you don't own any of the Doom games, get the shareware doom1.wad from doom19s.zip on Doomworld's shareware download page. http://www.doomworld.com/files/shareware.shtml
Supported files: .wad, .iwad
Source: https://github.com/libretro/libretro-prboom

The QuickNES core library, originally by Shay Green, heavily modified. QuickNES is a newer emulator that seems to have good compatibility.
Supported files: .nes
Source: https://github.com/libretro/QuickNES_Core

Snes9x is a portable, freeware SNES and Super Famicom emulator. Snes9x is coded in C++, with three assembler CPU emulation cores on the i386 Linux and Windows ports.
Supported files: .smc, .sfc, .swc, .fig
Icon credit: Alucryd (alucryd.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/snes9xgit/snes9x
extension.disclaimer: The Snes9X team is not connected or affiliated with any mentioned company in any way. The opinions of the Snes9X team do not reflect the views of the various companies mentioned here. Companies and all products pertaining to that company are trademarks of that company. Please contact that company for trademark and copyright information.

extension.description:
Snes9x-Next is based on Snes9x, but has been heavily modified/speed-hacked to achieve better speed.
Supported files: .smc, .fig, .sfc, .gd3, .gd7, .dx2, .bsx, .swc
Icon credit: Alucryd (alucryd.deviantart.com)
Source: https://github.com/libretro/snes9x-next

Stella is a multi-platform Atari 2600 VCS emulator. The Atari 2600 Video Computer System (VCS), introduced in 1977, was the most popular home video game system of the early 1980's. Now you can enjoy all of your favorite Atari 2600 games on your PC thanks to Stella!
Supported files: .a26, .bin
Stella was originally developed for Linux by Bradford W. Mott, and is currently maintained by Stephen Anthony.
Source: https://github.com/libretro/stella-libretro

Tyr-Quake is a branch of the Quake source code released by id. It's intended to support Quake and Quakeworld. Instead of changing the look or feel of the game by adding lots of rendering enhancements, it aims to just fix little bugs that have come up over the years.
Supported files: .pak
Source: https://github.com/libretro/tyrquake

VBA-Next is a fork from the now inactive VisualBoy Advance project, with goals to improve the capatibility and features of the emulator.
Supported files: .gba
Source: https://github.com/libretro/vba-next
This repository contains emulators for the RetroPlayer branch of XBMC.
extension.disclaimer: The owners and submitters to this repository do not host or distribute any of the content displayed by these addons nor do they have any affiliation with the content providers. Team XBMC did not make all the add-ons on this repository and are not responsible for their content.
